div.head: The prologue vpon the hystorye of Olyuer of Castylle.
div.p: BYcause that the memorye is the reteynynge & nature humayne for his fragylyte is strongely mouable / goodly hathe ben introducte that the reasons concludynge intendybly y• saynges / and also auctorytes of sayntes and dyscrete men / semblably hystoryes and examples worthy of commemoracyon ben reduced by wrytynge / for to shewe to them that ben to come that whiche hathe be sayd and done before to the instruccyon and saluacyon of the soule of euery good crystē man. ¶Now it is thus that is this present tyme the scryptures by the arte and ingenyous practyke of Pryntynge be multeplyed in suche a wyle that dyuers fayre and cōmodyous ensygnynges / and ensamples ben had / of whiche fewe folkes had the bokes and congnyssaunce / & nowe they ben put forth and vttred for so lytell a pryse that it can not be lyghtely lesse / neuerthelesse bycause of the vnderstādynge comune / that is better contente for to reteyne the hystoryes / and examples than other thynge / dyuers hystoryes ben put in wrytynge. And amonge ye other hystoryes is one founde of longe tyme wryten / the whiche is named the hystorye of Olyuer of Castylle / and Arthur of Algarbe his loiall felowe / the whiche for theyr vertues / and to loue better honoure than to consente to euyll / had grete aduersytees / and meruaylous fortunes and aduentures / the whiche by grete loyalte and ardaunt charyte / and also fydelyte and promesse / toke an ende solytarye.
